stories.text:
yy059 reformats and prints JSON
      yy045 removes chunked transfer encoding

        stunnel -fd 0 << eof
        debug=debug 
        pid=/tmp/1.pid
        foreground=no
        
        [ youtube ]
        accept=127.0.0.127:80 
        client=yes
        connect=74.125.21.91:443
        options=NO_TICKET
        options=NO_RENEGOTIATION
        renegotiation=no
        sni=
        sslVersion=TLSv1.3
eof

For searching YouTube:

      #!/bin/sh

      # usage: 1.sh query
      # usage: yy059 < 1.yts|1.sh >> 1.yts

      _x2_(){ local x=$(printf '\r\n');sed "s/ *//;s/$/$x/";};
      case $# in :)
      ;;0) # CONTINUATION_REQUEST
      KEY=AIzaSyAO_FJ2SlqU8Q4STEHLGCilw_Y9_11qcW8;
      MIN=\{\"context\":{\"client\":{\"hl\":\"en-US\",\"gl\":\"US\",\"clientName\":\"MWEB\",\"clientVersion\":\"2.20210916.06.01\"}},\"continuation\":;
      TOKEN=$(yy059|sed -n "s/$/}/;s/\"token\":/$MIN/p"|tail -1);
      test "$TOKEN"||exec echo done;

      _x2_ <<eof|nc -vvn 127.127 80|yy045 
      POST /youtubei/v1/search?key=$KEY HTTP/1.1
      Host: www.youtube.com
      Content-Length: ${#TOKEN}
      Content-Type: application/json
      Connection: close
   
      $TOKEN
eof

      ;;*) # REQUEST
      S=$(echo "$@"|sed 's/ /+/g');
      _x2_ <<eof|nc -vvn 127.127 80|yy045 
      GET /results?search_query=$S HTTP/1.1
      Host: www.youtube.com
      Connection: close
eof

      esac;
For retrieving YouTube channels, a similar script:

      #!/bin/sh

      # usage: 1.sh /c/name or 1.sh /channel/ID
      # usage: yy059 < 1.ytc|1.sh >> 1.ytc

      _x2_(){ local x=$(printf '\r\n');sed "s/ *//;s/$/$x/";};
      case $# in :)
      ;;0) # CONTINUATION
      KEY=AIzaSyAO_FJ2SlqU8Q4STEHLGCilw_Y9_11qcW8;
      MIN=\{\"context\":{\"client\":{\"hl\":\"en-US\",\"gl\":\"US\",\"clientName\":\"MWEB\",\"clientVersion\":\"2.20210916.06.01\"}},\"continuation\":;
      TOKEN=$(yy059|sed -n "s/$/}/;s/\"token\":/$MIN/p"|sed -n \$p);
      test "$TOKEN"||exec echo no more videos;

      _x2_ <<eof|nc -vvn 127.127 80|yy045 
      POST /youtubei/v1/browse?key=$KEY HTTP/1.1
      Host: www.youtube.com
      Content-Length: ${#TOKEN}
      Content-Type: application/json
      Connection: close
   
      $TOKEN
eof

      ;;*) # INITIAL 
      _x2_ <<eof|nc -vvn 127.127 80|yy045
      GET $1/videos HTTP/1.1
      Host: www.youtube.com
      Connection: close
eof

      esac;
Next up:

A JSON formatter to print the results as a table
